main event: In March 1955, a civilian reported observing three round, bright, silver and clear objects in the vicinity of Bakersfield, California, with no other characteristic features present.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately one minute.
The objects were described as white balloon-like, approximately the size of a baseball held at arm's length, and drifted and climbed in the sky.
The conclusion was that they were probably balloons, and further investigation was not authorized due to a lack of ATIS.
The report indicates that there were no photographs present to document the sighting.
This event was recorded as a Ground-Visual observation by a civilian source.
sighted object: three round, bright, silver and clear objects
